snp3.2:11.2: While this whole sutta flirts with the idea of self-mortification, the commentary, followed by Bodhi, takes it to the next level here, identifying _vedanā_ as extreme suffering. No doubt in the previous verse such suffering might apply, but we have just been told that the faculties, including _samādhi_ have grown strong. The next line indicates freedom from sensuality. All this agrees with the normal Sutta description of the feeling in jhana.
